properties.Name: The Metropolitan Museum of Art (The Met)
properties.landmark: The Metropolitan Museum of Art (The Met)
properties.description:
Significance: The largest art museum in the United States, housing a collection spanning 5,000 years. 
Key artifacts: The Egyptian *Temple of Dendur*, works by Vincent van Gogh (*Self-Portrait with a Straw Hat*), and Emanuel Leutze’s *Washington Crossing the Delaware*.

properties.Name: The British Museum
properties.description:
Significance: Established in 1753 as the first national public museum in the world. 
Key artifacts: The *Rosetta Stone*, the *Elgin Marbles* (Parthenon Sculptures), the *Sutton Hoo Ship Burial Helmet*, and the *Lewis Chessmen*.

properties.Name: Uffizi Gallery
properties.description:
Significance: Built in the 16th century for the Medici family, it is a primary repository for Italian Renaissance art. 
Key artifacts: Botticelli’s *The Birth of Venus* and *Primavera*, Michelangelo’s *Doni Tondo*, and Titian’s *Venus of Urbino*.

properties.Name: Rijksmuseum
properties.description:
Significance: The national museum of the Netherlands, dedicated to Dutch art and history, particularly the Dutch Golden Age. 
Key artifacts: Rembrandt’s *The Night Watch*, Vermeer’s *The Milkmaid*, and Frans Hals’ *The Merry Drinker*.

properties.Name: The Museum of Modern Art (MoMA)
properties.description:
Significance: Founded in 1929, it was the first museum exclusively devoted to modern art. 
Key artifacts: Van Gogh’s *The Starry Night*, Picasso’s *Les Demoiselles d’Avignon*, and Dalí’s *The Persistence of Memory*.

properties.Name: Prado Museum
properties.description:
Significance: Opened in 1819, it houses the Spanish Royal Collection with a focus on Spanish, Italian, and Flemish painting. 
Key artifacts: Velázquez’s *Las Meninas*, Goya’s *The Third of May 1808*, and Bosch’s *The Garden of Earthly Delights*.

properties.Name: State Hermitage Museum
properties.description:
Significance: Housed in the Winter Palace, it is one of the oldest and largest museums, started by Catherine the Great in 1764. 
Key artifacts: Leonardo da Vinci’s *Madonna Litta* and *Benois Madonna*, and Rembrandt’s *The Return of the Prodigal Son*.

properties.Name: Vatican Museums
properties.description:
Significance: A vast complex housing art amassed by popes over centuries, dating back to Pope Julius II in the 16th century. 
Key artifacts: Michelangelo’s Sistine Chapel ceiling frescoes and *Last Judgment*, the *Raphael Rooms* (*School of Athens*), and *Laocoön and His Sons*.

properties.Name: National Archaeological Museum (Athens)
properties.description:
Significance: Houses important artifacts recovered from Greek history, including shipwrecks. 
Key artifacts: The Antikythera Mechanism, a geared device used to calculate astronomical phenomena.

properties.Name: National Museum of Archaeology (Malta)
properties.description:
Significance: Houses artifacts from Malta's prehistoric sites. 
Key artifacts: The "Sleeping Lady" statuette found at the Ħal Saflieni Hypogeum.

properties.Name: Museum of the Central Reserve Bank of Peru
properties.landmark: Museum of the Central Reserve Bank of Peru
properties.description: Key artifacts: Nasca ceramics, including statues of feminine deities.

properties.Name: The Louvre Museum
properties.description:
Significance: Largest art museum in the world by exhibition space, originally a fortress and royal palace.
Key artifacts: Mona Lisa, Venus de Milo, Winged Victory of Samothrace, Code of Hammurabi.

properties.Name: Pyramids of Giza
properties.description: Key features: Great Pyramid of Khufu: Built c. 2551 B.C., it is the largest ancient pyramid, standing 450 feet high.; Pyramid of Khafre: Built c. 2520 B.C., featuring the Sphinx complex.

properties.Name: Saqqara Necropolis
properties.description: Key features: Pyramid of Djoser: Built 2630–2611 B.C., it is the first "step pyramid" designed by Imhotep.; Serapeum of Saqqara: Contains massive granite sarcophagi for sacred bulls, noted for their geometric precision and airtight lids.

properties.Name: Abydos
properties.description: Key features: Osireion (or Osirion): A subterranean structure behind the Temple of Seti I, possibly a cenotaph for Seti I (c. 1294–1279 BCE) or a symbolic tomb of Osiris.; Temple of Seti I: Built in the 13th century BCE.

properties.Name: Taposiris Magna
properties.description: Significance: A temple complex where recent excavations have uncovered mummies, coins bearing Cleopatra VII's image, and a large cemetery; theorized by some to be the location of the tomb of Antony and Cleopatra. Date: Includes remains of a Greek temple from the 4th century BC; walls constructed in the 1st century BC.

properties.Name: Nubian Pyramids
properties.description: Significance: Hundreds of steep sandstone pyramidal tombs from the Kushite kingdom. Date: c. 300 B.C. to 300 A.D..

properties.Name: Richat Structure (Eye of the Sahara)
properties.description: Significance: A geological dome 40-50 km in diameter, once theorized to be Atlantis, but actually formed by uplift and erosion. Date: Formed approximately 100 million years ago.

properties.Name: Gobekli Tepe
properties.description: Significance: The world's oldest known temple complex, built by hunter-gatherers, featuring massive T-shaped limestone pillars with animal carvings. Date: c. 9600–8200 BCE.

properties.Name: Cappadocia Underground Cities
properties.description: Date: Origins potentially 8th–7th century BCE (Phrygian); expanded during the Byzantine era. Key features: Derinkuyu: An 18-story deep underground city that could shelter 20,000 people, used by Christians to escape persecution.; Kaymakli: A wider, shallower underground complex connected to Derinkuyu by tunnels.

properties.Name: Catalhoyuk
properties.description: Significance: A dense, proto-urban Neolithic settlement. Date: Settled 9,000 years ago.

properties.Name: Al Khazna (The Treasury)
properties.description: Significance: A mausoleum carved into sandstone cliffs, likely for Nabataean King Aretas IV. Date: 1st century AD (reign of Aretas IV, 9 BC–40 AD).

properties.Name: Baalbek
properties.description: Significance: A colossal Roman temple complex (Heliopolis) built on Phoenician/Canaanite foundations, famous for the "Trilithon" stones weighing 800 tonnes. Date: Roman complex built over centuries; site inhabited for 11,000 years.

properties.Name: Ziggurat of Ur
properties.description: Significance: A tiered temple built for the Sumerian king Ur-Nammu. Date: Mid-21st century B.C..

properties.Name: Great Wall of China
properties.description: Significance: A vast military fortification; the Han Dynasty extensions utilized sand, gravel, and rose willow. Date: Han Dynasty construction mostly by 121 BC; original sections date back to Warring States (c. 7th century BC).

properties.Name: Longyou Grottoes
properties.description: Significance: Massive ancient underground artificial caverns of unknown origin. Date: Unknown.

properties.Name: Hanging Temple
properties.description: Significance: A temple built into a cliff face integrating Buddhism, Taoism, and Confucianism. Date: Built in 491 AD.

properties.Name: Dujiangyan
properties.description: Significance: An ancient irrigation system still in use today, functioning without dams. Date: Built c. 256 BC.

properties.Name: Angkor Wat
properties.description: Significance: The largest religious monument in the world, originally Hindu, dedicated to Vishnu. Date: 1116–1150 CE.

properties.Name: Angkor Thom
properties.description: Significance: A fortified city featuring the Bayon Temple with massive stone faces, built by King Jayavarman VII. Date: Late 12th century CE.

properties.Name: Masuda-no-Iwafune
properties.description: Significance: An 800-ton carved granite monolith known as the "Rock Ship." Date: Uncertain, possibly 7th century CE.

properties.Name: Ishi no Hoden
properties.description: Significance: A megalithic monument appearing to float on water, worshipped as a Shintai. Date: Recorded as standing 1,300 years ago.

properties.Name: Rujm el-Hiri
properties.description: Significance: A megalithic monument of concentric stone circles, potentially used for excarnation or seasonal rituals. Date: Chalcolithic/Early Bronze Age.

properties.Name: Newgrange
properties.description: Significance: A passage tomb aligned with the winter solstice sunrise, part of the Brú na Bóinne complex. Date: c. 3200 BCE.

properties.Name: Skara Brae
properties.description: Significance: A remarkably intact Neolithic village revealed by a storm in 1850. Date: Occupied c. 3180–2500 BCE.

properties.Name: Goseck Circle
properties.description: Significance: A Neolithic circular enclosure possibly serving as a solar observatory. Date: c. 4900 BC.

properties.Name: Al Saflieni Hypogeum
properties.description: Significance: An underground Neolithic burial complex carved across three levels. Date: 4000 BC – 1500 BC.

properties.Name: Pyramid of Cestius
properties.description: Significance: A steep, pointed pyramid built as a tomb for a Roman magistrate. Date: c. 12 B.C..

properties.Name: Teotihuacán
properties.description: Significance: Ancient metropolis featuring the **Pyramid of the Sun** (built over a natural cave) and **Pyramid of the Moon**. Date: Pyramid of the Sun completed c. 125 CE; city flourished 150 BCE–650 CE.

properties.Name: Great Pyramid of Cholula
properties.description: Significance: The largest pyramid by volume in the world, now resembling a grassy hill topped by a church. Date: Built in stages by pre-Columbian people; utilized by Aztecs.

properties.Name: Tikal
properties.description: Significance: A major Maya urban center with five pyramidal temples. Date: c. 300–900 A.D..

properties.Name: Chavin de Huantar
properties.description: Significance: A massive temple complex with underground channels and carvings. Date: c. 900–200 B.C..

properties.Name: Moray Terraces
properties.description: Significance: Concentric agricultural terraces with significant temperature differences from top to bottom. Date: Inca civilization.

properties.Name: Nazca Lines
properties.description: Significance: Giant geoglyphs of animals and shapes etched into the desert floor. Date: Created between 500 B.C. and A.D. 500.

properties.Name: Pumapunku
properties.description: Significance: Ruins featuring incredibly precise geometric stone carvings. Date: Tiwanaku culture.

properties.Name: Las Bolas / Diquís Spheres
properties.description: Significance: Hundreds of nearly perfect stone spheres found in the Diquís Delta. Date: c. 800–1500 A.D..

properties.Name: Olmec Heads
properties.description: Significance: Giant carved stone heads depicting rulers. Date: Olmec civilization.

properties.Name: Nan Madol
properties.description: Significance: A "floating city" of 92 artificial islets built of basalt columns. Date: Constructed c. 700–1600 C.E..

properties.Name: Rano Raraku & Moai Sites
properties.description: Significance: The quarry for 95% of the island's monolithic Moai statues. Date: Moai carved approx. 1400–1650 A.D..
